snippet: Colgate University is giving its collection of more than 100 drawings and paintings by Aboriginal children who were forced into government camps to Curtin University in Perth.
abstract: Trove of paintings and drawings made by Aboriginal children living in Australian settlement camp in 1940s and 1950s will be transferred from Colgate University in Hamilton, NY, to Curtin University in Perth.
lead_paragraph: Colgate University is giving its collection of more than 100 drawings and paintings by Aboriginal children who were forced into government camps to Curtin University in Perth.

headline.seo: Colgate to Give Aboriginal Art to Australian University
headline.main: Aboriginal Artworks to Return to Australia
headline.print_headline: Aboriginal Artworks To Return To Australia
